title: USA TODAY Releases Third AR Project of 2019
text:
CLOSE

USA TODAY released its latest augmented reality project, "New Heights: Groundbreaking skyscrapers", an introduction and exploration into some of the world’s tallest skyscrapers. This marks USA TODAY’s third AR project of the year.

During the experience, users will have access to five building to compare and contrast, learn about the technology and facts about the buildings. Users will be able to navigate the towers through a gallery card, swiping left or right to change the skyscraper.

Featured skyscrapers within the experience include:

Empire State

One World Trade Center

Petronas

Willis Tower

Burj Khalifa

“We’re excited to bring these most marvels of engineering into your home through augmented reality. See how they compare to one another and learn what makes each one unique.”

The experience also includes three to five points of internet for audiences to learn about technological advance that were used for the construction of the building. The end of the experience includes a timeline of all five buildings which display together for a full visual comparison.

You can access the experience on iOS or Android.

Read or Share this story: https://www.usatoday.com/story/news/pr/2019/04/09/usa-today-released-skyscraper-ar-project/3405016002/
description: USA TODAY released its latest augmented reality project today, "New Heights: Groundbreaking skyscrapers", an introduction and exploration into some of the world’s tallest skyscrapers.
